Package p4_group_8_repo.actor

Class Actor

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.image.ImageView
p4_group_8_repo.actor.Actor
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
Animal, BackgroundImage, Character, End, Frame, Log, NonSinkingTurtle, Obstacle, SinkingTurtle
public abstract class Actor
extends javafx.scene.image.ImageView
This abstract class provides the game with objects that has animations and movements.
Author:
Liew Yih Seng

  • Constructor Details

    • Actor

      public Actor()

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move​(double dx, double dy)
      This method provides objects with movements. It invokes the method ImageView.setX(double) and ImageView.setY(double) to set the movement of the actor.
      Parameters:
      dx - A double that represents the movement in the X-axis.
      dy - A double that represents the movement in Y-axis.

    • getWorld

      public World getWorld()
      Gets the world in the application.
      Returns:
      The world in the application.

    • getWidth

      public double getWidth()
      Gets the horizontal width of this Actor.
      Returns:
      A double representing the width.

    • getHeight

      public double getHeight()
      Gets the vertical height of this Actor.
      Returns:
      A double representing the height.

    • getIntersectingObjects

      public <A extends Actor> List<A> getIntersectingObjects​(Class<A> cls)
      Checks for all other Actor that currently intersect with this.
      Type Parameters:
      A - A class that extends class Actor.
      Parameters:
      cls - Represents the class that extends Actor to look for.
      Returns:
      The array of Actor that intersects one another.

    • getOneIntersectingObject

      public <A extends Actor> A getOneIntersectingObject​(Class<A> cls)
      Checks for a single Actor object that intersects with this.
      Type Parameters:
      A - A class that extends class Actor.
      Parameters:
      cls - Represents the class that extends Actor to look for.
      Returns:
      The first intersecting Actor object that intersects with this.

    • setCoordinate

      public void setCoordinate​(int x, int y)
      A method that sets the X-coordinate and the Y-coordinate of the actor. It invokes ImageView.setX(double) and ImageView.setY(double) to position the actor within the game scene.
      Parameters:
      x - An integer representing the X-coordinate of the actor in the game scene.
      y - An integer representing the Y-coordinate of the actor in the game scene.

    • loopEnterScreenLeft

      public void loopEnterScreenLeft​(int xEnteringLeft, int xCompLeft, double speed)
      This method reloops the actor back into the screen from the left side. It checks if the actor has exited the game scene from the right, if the condition returns true, it will invoke the method ImageView.setX(double) to reset the position of the actor in the X-axis then allowing the actor to reenter the game scene.
      Parameters:
      xEnteringLeft - An integer representing the initial X-coordinate of the actor within the game scene.
      xCompLeft - An integer representing the completion X-coordinate of the actor within the game scene.
      speed - A double that represents the movement speed of the actor.

    • loopEnterScreenRight

      public void loopEnterScreenRight​(int xEnteringRight, int xCompRight, double speed)
      This method reloops the actor back into the screen from the right side. It checks if the actor has exited the game scene from the left, if the condition returns true, if will invoke the method ImageView.setX(double) to reset the position of the actor in the X-axis then allowing the actor to reenter the game scene.
      Parameters:
      xEnteringRight - An integer representing the initial X-coordinate of the actor within the game scene.
      xCompRight - An integer representing the completion X-coordinate of the actor within the game scene.
      speed - A double that represents the movement speed of the actor.

    • act

      public abstract void act​(long now)
      An abstract method that should be inherited by its child class to represent how its child class should react during clock tick.
      Parameters:
      now - A long integer representing the current clock tick.
